metadata.name: The Fluid Batheress
metadata.description:
“The Fluid Batheress” is my contemporary, obvious abstract interpretation of an oil painting by Jean-Auguste Dominique Ingres, a French classicist oil painter. Ingres called his painting “The Small Bather”, finished it 1826 and depicts a woman, leisurely sitting in a bath. 

I interpreted the painting with heavy-body and high flow acrylics, as well as acrylic inks.  

Digitally it has a dimension of 2500x3100px, the physical artwork is in private collection and not for sale.
